contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox family name |name = Weidmann, Weidman |image = Flood-meadow near Hohenau.jpg |image_size = |caption = |pronunciation = |meaning = 1. {{lang-de|die [[Weide]]}} means "[[pasture]], [[meadow]]", also "[[willow]]"<br>{{Wikt|Weide}}<br>2. [[Middle High German|MHG/mhd.]] ''weideman'' "[[huntsman]], [[fisherman]]"<br>3. Jewish given name "[[Widder]]", Judaic hypocristic form of "[[Avigdor]]". |founder = |region = Germany, Austria, Russia, Israel ({{lang-he|ויידמן}}) |chief = |nationality = German, Jewish |language = German |related names = [[Weydmann]], [[Waidmann]], etc. ; Similar formed names: * [[Weide]], [[Weiden]], [[Weidl]], [[Weider]], [[Weidler]], [[Weidner]], [[Weidlich]], [[Weidig]], [[Weidinger]], [[Weidauer]] * [[Weidemann]] ([[Weideman]]) * [[Weidenmann]] ([[Weidenman]]) * [[Weitmann]] ([[Weitman]])<ref>[[:de:Weitmann]]</ref> * [[Wiedmann]] ([[Wiedman]]) * [[Wiedemann]] ([[Wiedeman]]) * [[Weidemeyer]] ([[Weidemaier]]), [[Weidenmayer]] * [[Weidenbach]] * [[Weidenbaum]] (means "willow tree") * [[Weidenfeld]] * [[Weidhaas]], [[Weidhase]], [[Weidehaas]] * [[Weidenmüller]] * [[Weidenreich]] |clans = |footnotes = |nolinklanguage = yes }} '''Weidmann''' (or '''Weidman''') is a [[German language|German]] surname meaning "hunter". It may refer to: * [[Charles Weidman]] (1901–1975), American modern dancer, choreographer and teacher * [[Chris Weidman]] (born 1984), American mixed martial artist * [[Eugen Weidmann]] (1908–1939), a German convict who was the last to be publicly executed in France * [[Franz Seraph Weidmann]] (1790, Vienna - 1867, Vienna), Austrian actor, poet, dramatist and topographer, nephew of Paul Weidmann<ref>http://www.aeiou.at/aeiou.encyclop.w/w273255.htm</ref> * [[Jens Weidmann]] (born 1968), president of Deutsche Bundesbank<ref>[[:de:Jens Weidmann]]</ref> * [[Jerome Weidman]] (1913–1998), Jewish American playwright and novelist * [[Joachim Weidmann]] (born 1939), German mathematician<ref>[[:de:Joachim Weidmann]]</ref> * [[Jodi Weidmann-Sparks]],..... * [[John Weidman]], American librettist and staff writer for ''Sesame Street'' * [[Karl Weidmann]] (born 1931), Swiss rower<ref>[[:de:Karl Weidmann]]</ref> * [[Kurt Weidmann]] (born 1937), Hessian politician<ref>[[:de:Kurt Weidmann]]</ref> * [[Manfred Weidmann]] (born 1945) German footballer<ref>[[:de:Manfred Weidmann]]</ref> * Moritz Georg Weidmann ** [[Moritz Georg Weidmann (1658–1693)]], German publisher and bookseller<ref>[[:de:Moritz Georg Weidmann (1658–1693)]]</ref> ** [[Moritz Georg Weidmann (1686 - 1743)]], German publisher and bookseller, son of the Elder * [[Paul Weidmann]] (1744–1801), Austrian writer<ref>[[:de:Paul Weidmann]], http://www.aeiou.at/aeiou.encyclop.w/w274709.htm</ref> * [[Thure Weidman]] (1789–1828), bishop<ref>see [[:de:Liste der Bischöfe von Skara]]</ref> == Vaidman == * [[Lev Vaidman]] (born 1955), an Israeli physicist ** [[Elitzur–Vaidman bomb-tester]] == See also == * [[Weidmann's Restaurant]], a restaurant in Meridian, Mississippi owned since 1870 by the Swiss-born Felix Weidmann and his family * [[Weidman, Michigan]] ; Related surnames: * [[Weidemann]] {{Reflist}} {{surname|Weidmann, Weidman, [[Weydmann]], Vaidman; [[Waidmann]]}} [[Category:German-language surnames]] [[Category:Jewish surnames]] [[Category:Occupational surnames]]
